mentions.context: SPM function that provides the estimate of the REML ELBO computed by SPM).
The analysis code used in this study is publicly available (Lutti, 2021).
Data were analysed using Statistical Parametric Mapping (SPM12, Wellcome Centre for Human Neuroimaging, London).
The nonlinear diffeomorphic algorithm Dartel (Ashburner, 2007) was used for inter-subject registration of the tissue classes.

The implementation used here, within the SPM software (Friston, Stephan, Lund, Morcom, & Kiebel, 2005), is commonly used to account for differential noise levels in, for example, group-comparison studies ('non-sphericity').
Quantitative MRI maps were computed from the raw MRI data using the hMRI toolbox (Tabelow et al., 2019) and bespoke analysis scripts written in MATLAB (The MathWorks Inc., Natick, MA, USA).
SPM function that provides the estimate of the REML ELBO computed by SPM).
The ELBO estimates were obtained from the implementation of REML within the SPM software (Friston et al., 2002).

To facilitate uptake by interested users, we provide a customised version of the hMRI toolbox (Tabelow et al., 2019) with a dedicated QUIQI module available from the GUI (Lutti, Di Domenicantonio, Corbin, Phillips, & Callaghan, 2021).
Statistical analyses were carried out after estimating the parameters of a general linear model with SPM12.
The value of the MDI described in Castella et al. (2018) was computed for each R2* map, as provided by the hMRI toolbox (Tabelow et al., 2019).
Quantitative MRI maps were computed from the raw MRI data using the hMRI toolbox (Tabelow et al., 2019) and bespoke analysis scripts written in MATLAB (The MathWorks Inc., Natick, MA, USA).

Instead, the use of REML for the computation of the weights provides estimates of ELBO as measures of noise model efficiency (the analysis code attached to this manuscript includes a customised version of the 'spm_est_non_sphericity'
Quantitative MRI maps were computed from the raw MRI data using the hMRI toolbox (Tabelow et al., 2019) and bespoke analysis scripts written in MATLAB (The MathWorks Inc., Natick, MA, USA).
The tissue probability maps were normalised to the stereotactic space of the Montreal Neurological Institute (MNI) template using the resulting Dartel template and the deformation fields.
